name: Leasowe Castle

reviews.text: We stayed here because we were attending British Open in Southport and could not find hotel in Southport. This hotel is located on the other side of the river from Liverpool and is right on the ocean. Golf course in front of property. About 6 metro stops from downtown Liverpool. Takes about 20 minutes and then a walk of a little over a mile. No taxis from Leasowe metro so be prepared to walk. Nothing else in the neighborhood but this old casle/hotel. Grocery store about half mile down the road between metro and hotel.
reviews.title: A bit out of the way

likes.disliked: — Need a car to stay here

reviews.text: Room was small but charming, with a window overlooking the golf course and sea. Very windy in this area. Staff was very, very nice. A little bar to enjoy a brew, and a nice sitting room downstairs. Would have been nice if they would have lit a fire on the cold nights in this charming room. Buffet breakfast in a very prettiy breakfast room. Food was ok but typical British fare.
reviews.title: Worst night's sleep

likes.disliked: — the noise and the customer service

reviews.title: excellent stay
reviews.text: In general, not much in area (a bedroom community near some large businesses). Good if you are there to play golf. Dress warm. Inclement weather in this part of England.

We visited the hotel for a wedding, and stayed for 1 night. After the ceremony and photographs, we decided to check in, as the time was now comfortably after 3pm. However, some members of our party were informed that their room was still not ready.
reviews.title: Not a good experiance

reviews.text: Our room was a comfortable size, with sea-view, although the decor was very dated. The bathroom smelt musty and was again dated, with paint peeling from the ceiling.
reviews.title: This should be a nice hotel, but some problems prevented it for me.

likes.liked: — Price. Room furnishing very good. Gym and hot rooms. Bar is full of comfortable sofas, with a separate menu to restaurant.

reviews.text: I got married at leasowe castle and can only describe it as the most awful hotel i have ever stayed in. The staff were very young, inexperienced, rude and unhelpful to the point where they used wedding cameras left on guests tables to take pictures of each other. The food was cold. The service was slow. The rooms are shoddy in appearance There was even holes in the ceilings where they rain was coming and they had placed buckets on the floor underneath.. The only good thing i have to say is that the ladies who served breakfast were lovely its a shame the same cant be said for the rest of the staff...
reviews.title: Unimpressed

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel recently while visiting family in the United Kingdom. Fortunately I only spent one night there. My bed was very uncomfortable with springs ready to come through the mattress. The bar had no atmosphere whatsoever and no attempt had been made to decorate the bar and lounge area to make if feel comfortable and relaxing. Both the bar and lounge were filled with smokers and I ended up taking my drink to my room to escape the smoke.
reviews.title: Lumpy Beds

reviews.text: The reception staff and wait staff at breakfast were very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Faded Grandeur
Faulty Towers!!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Leasowe Castle Hotel recently whilst attending an event in Wallasey. It's a magnificent building in a marvellous setting, adjoining Leasowe golf course and with splendid views over Liverpool Bay. Unfortunately, although the management appear to be gradually improving the facilities ( eg new leisure complex) the place still needs a lot of money spending on it especially if it aspires to be a top notch conference hotel. For such a potentially opulent venue the bar was decidedly down market with MTV blasting away on the TV and a generally shabby atmosphere. Staff were very helpful and friendly but then this is Merseyside! The bedroom was terribly jaded. Bathroom fittings were very 1970s. No complaints about the breakfast though which was excellent and the service by the Northern Irish waitress was impeccable and friendly. It's not a bad place to stay but it could be so much better.

The web site does little to describe the actual quality of the hotel. Whilst I have to say the staff were generally very polite and cheerful, sadly the room, décor and cleanliness were not so good. My comments are as follows;
reviews.title: Our Stay

reviews.text: We booked our wedding including the ceremony at the hotel in February 07. The hotel itself has a unique charm which makes it a perfect venue for wedding or weekend stay. The food was excellent, with numerous guests saying they thought it was the best food they had had at a wedding. The rooms were great with good views of the golf course and promenade. And above all, the staff were without exception efficient., helpful, warm and friendly. I would not hesitate to recommend this venue to anyone contemplating a function or just a weekend away. Thanks to everyone at the Castle. Angela
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: On behalf of every single person that attended the wedding of Kellie and Dan on teh 19th August 2006, we would like to say a big massive thank you to each and every one of the staff the food and service was second to none from start to finish we would have no hesistation in recomending your hotel to anyone wanting to hold a function in your area that you again Billy & Margaret Halliday.
reviews.title: Great Wedding Recomend to Anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Leasowe Castle for a weekend. I should have been suspicious when they asked if we were attending a wedding at the hotel. We weren't and were charged £100 per night for the priviledge. The Leasowe Castle runs two weddings per day over the weekend, it's geared for people who get so legless they don't care where they rest their heads. Our room was ropey. We literally had to kick the door in to get into the room. It rained during the night and water came pouring in through the (rather attractive) suspended ceiling. The room smelled damp and the Housekeeping Manager tried to tell me it was the smell of the new carpet!
reviews.title: A dire hotel that needs a wake-up call

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a drink in the bar, which reminded me of a badly refurbished working men's club. The saving grace was the breakfast - a hearty affair served by your gran on a table adorned by a tea-stained table cloth. Truly Fawlty Towers.
reviews.title: location great

likes.disliked: — dining room very warm would have liked facilities to eat outside in good weather/conservatory would be nice with air conditioning

reviews.text: visiting to see our new grandson,
reviews.title: great exploring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful old castle with nice rooms. The staff was very nice. We had a terrific dinner in their dining room (best of our two-week vacation in Great Britain). The breakfast (included) was nice--we had a light breakfast but they would have cooked for us. We enjoyed looking around the castle and grounds. On the slight downside, the bathroom floor was slippery even when dry, the shower curtain was flimsy and let water escape to the floor, and there was no handrail in the tub. The castle is located outside Liverpool so you will need a car or other transportation to the city.
reviews.title: Beautiful, interesting place

reviews.text: Had a smashing night out at the Leasowe Castle Hotel with 25 of our guests for a 40th birthday. we took in the Elvis Murder mystery event and everyone thouroughly enjoyed it. I stay in many hotels each week through my work and it was nice to find a hotel with a bit of character rather than the drab and faceless hotels I normally stay in! I have read the reviews and did not experience anything negative. In my humble opinion the Leasowe Castle Hotel ticks all the boxes, food was great and accomodation was comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Great night out...

likes.disliked: — Nothing it was all ok for me

reviews.title: Hen Package
reviews.text: Myself and 8 others have just returned from a hen weekend at Leasowe Castle Hotel. When we booked the hen weekend package we thought that the cost was extremely reasonable for the activities included i.e a murder mystery including 3 course meal, 2 nights accommodation including full breakfast, 3 course meal on the second night also, a 30 minute beauty traetment of your choice and 1 hour Pole dancing lesson, so little did we expect such wonderful hospitality from each and every member of staff, fantastic surroundings and location. Nothing was ever too much trouble and I couldn't have imagined how much fun we had. My sincere thanks to all of the staff. The weekend exceeded my expectations in every way and we had 1 very happy hen! I think that it is safe to say that we will be back, but in the meantime would not hesitate in recommending a visit to this hotel to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fond memories which will be cherished by all.
reviews.title: Wonderful wedding experience

likes.liked: — The staff - couldn't fault them in any way!

reviews.text: My husband and I had our wedding reception at the hotel. The staff were wonderful. They knew exactly what they were doing, they were efficient and unobtrusive. Everything was carried out as requested. The food was lovely, the buffet was huge - much more than we expected to get and more than anyone managed to eat!
reviews.title: Overrated and overpriced.

description: Leasowe Castle offers a stunning venue with extensive facilities. The castle is a unique grade II listed building overlooking the stunning Wirral coastline and Leasowe golf course. Set amongst beautiful, tranquil gardens it offers a peaceful retreat for both work and leisure, yet is only minutes from the M53 offering quick access to Liverpool, Chester and the glorious Cheshire countryside. It is one of the most historic hotels in Wirral.Leasowe rail station is only a few minutes walk away and the airports of Liverpool and Manchester are easily reached. Such an enviable location is hard to find. It is an ideal location if you are looking for hotels near Liverpool and hotels near Merseyside.This romantic 16th century castle provides the perfect setting for weddings and special events. It is Wirral's only castle wedding venue. Offering a choice of function rooms and banqueting facilities we cater for parties of all sizes. Our attention to detail and impeccable service are guaranteed to make your special day simply perfect. If you are looking for a conference hotel in Wirral, the hotel also provide a unique and inspirational setting for meetings and conferences. Its convenient location combined with ample free parking, state-of-the-art conference facilities and comfortable accommodation, offers everything you need to focus, reflect and plan ahead. All guests have free access to the ‘Castle Club’ leisure facilities which offer a great way to unwind. You can workout in the fully equipped gym, join one of the exercise classes, or simply relax in the sauna and steam room. Afterwards, what better way to reward yourself than enjoying a sumptuous meal in the elegant Portcullis restaurant?
